He has been a leader in finding ways to make our schools safer, and I am proud to continue working with him to obtain these funds.

I thank @maxschachter, who tragically lost his son at Parkland, for his ongoing commitment to this issue. He worked diligently with my staff and I to include language in this funding bill, encouraging schools to use federal grant money for these hardening measures.

Metal detectors + other deterrents can help prevent another devastating incident like Parkland from happening again. The legislation also ensures school districts and local law enforcement officers have the proper resources to mitigate + respond to emergency and crises situations

This legislation includes $100 million for the STOP School Violence Act, of which I was a co-sponsor of and was signed into law last year by President Trump. This grant program is a critical investment for localities who seek to improve their school hardening capabilities.
On the anniversary of the Parkland tragedy, I am honored to say we approved additional funding for school safety in tonight’s government funding bill.

I congratulate @RepKayGranger @NitaLowey. It’s because of their willingness to negotiate in good faith that we were able to reach this bipartisan agreement. I look forward to working with them + our colleagues to begin the FY20 process to fund critical programs families rely on.
•$9 billion for anti-terrorism programs, international trafficking prevention, the Countering Russian Influence Fund, and other key national security efforts
•Robust funding to study the devastating algal blooms that hurt Florida’s water supply+tourism industry last year, looking into mitigation for better response + preparedness against future outbreaks
•Reaffirms the U.S.’ commitment to Israel, one of our strongest allies, bolstering its self-defense and security.

BUT! That’s not all the bill includes. Other items important to #SoFla:
•$37.5 billion to help mom and pop #smallbiz through @Sbagov 7(a) and 504 loan programs 
•$1.01B to combat citrus greening and other invasive species harming Florida’s iconic crop and our farmers+growers🍊

Community Development Block Grants (CDBG) + the Home Investment Partnership Program, which allow municipalities to expand access to affordable housing, continue to see strong $ levels. I recognize the importance of ensuring our neediest receive the housing and care they need.
In respect to housing🏠, the bill prioritizes funding for our most vulnerable populations, helping the elderly, disabled individuals, veterans, and those living with HIV/AIDS.

Just one example:Over $800M is provided for Transit Infrastructure Grants, including $350M for Bus+Bus Facilities Grants that support our local public bus systems. @MiamiDadeCounty received 2 grants from this program last yr + will hopefully see further dollars in the coming year
In fact, Southern Florida has already reaped the benefits of these programs in the previous year, and I am confident we will continue to see investments made in our communities this year. #SoFla

The legislation continues the strong levels of funding for BUILD grants, Capital Investment Grants, + Airports and Highway Grants, allowing localities like those in @CollierPIO, Hendry County, + @MiamiDadeCounty to compete for federal money to upgrade and expand their facilities
I’m proud of my work to support Florida’s seaports and I look forward to building on this program in the future. Sailing away from ports and into other #transport items in this bill...

This seaport funding will have a direct benefit to the Sunshine State. $93 million is set aside for the top 15 container ports, which includes both @PortMiami @PortEverglades, with priority given to projects with a critical issue both ports face - fumigation fees.

Over the past year I heard from so many port authorities in Florida and across the nation on the need for a dedicated port funding pool. That’s why nearly $300 million is delivered in this legislation to improve our nation’s seaports.

It furthers historic levels of funding to repair our nation’s aging infrastructure. It’s continued progress towards revitalizing our roadways, bridges, airports, transit systems, ❗️and for the first time❗️, our seaports! 🚢

Tonight, the House approved the remainder of the bills to fund our government for FY19. This package includes the #transport #housing bill I drafted as Chairman last Congress working with my Democratic counterpart, @RepDavidEPrice. Here’s some info about that bill:

Because of Max’s leadership, we were able to increase funding for school hardening measures in the government spending bill.  I will continue work with my colleagues, Max, and others to do everything we can to make sure our schools are safe for our children.
